H0.text: Rain gauge is the best piece of equipment to use in this experiment to measure the independent variable, the temperature that determines the best growing conditions for tomato plants.

H1.text: Light meter is the best piece of equipment to use in this experiment to measure the independent variable, which is the temperature best for growing tomato plants.

H2.text: Tape measure is the best piece of equipment to use in this experiment to measure the independent variable, temperature, when determining the best temperature for growing tomato plants.

H3.text: Thermometer is the best piece of equipment to measure the independent variable—temperature—in a student’s experiment to determine the best temperature for growing tomato plants.

A4.text: According to British Standards, correctly calibrated, used and maintained liquid-in-glass thermometers can achieve a measurement uncertainty of ±0.01 °C in the range 0 to 100 °C
